description.p: The community domain focuses on the ties that bind all people together. These are the ties of family and friendship, the ties to ancestors, as well as the ties between elders and the next generation with whom they share their wisdom. ‘The power of the Gods of community is in the security of home and hearth, and the joy of good company. Many such gods teach the value of tradition and simple ways of living in harmony with the natural world. They also tend towards the rule of law, not as a kind of great bureaucracy, but as sacred traditions passed from generation to generation. Some gods advocate the removal of harsh or disruptive forces to this order, and proper sanctions for the violation of the goodwill that any community ought to provide.
Clerics of such gods value unity, and praise the strength that can be gained when people support each other.

tr.td: Domain Spells, Blessing of the Hearth

description.p: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Community Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature in the Player’s Handbook for how domain spells work.

From 1st level, you gain the ability to conjure a small flagstone hearth with a simple iron cooking pot whenever you rest. This hearth helps warm you and your companions, and can be used to prepare hearty and nutritious meals on the road. If you or any friendly creatures you make camp with would regain hit points at the end of a short rest by spending one or more hit dice, each of those creatures may choose to re-roll one of their resting dice, taking the higher roll between the two.
Additionally, you gain proficiency with Cook’s Utensils.

sheet.description: You can conjure a small stone hearth with an iron cooking pot. It warms you and your companions, and can be used to prepare meals. If you or an ally you camp with would regain HP by spending hit dice: they may re-roll one of their resting dice, and take the higher roll.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you may use your Channel Divinity to conjure a magical feast for the rough road ahead. By spending 10 minutes, you may create a number of delicious, well-prepared, yet simple food items equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). These food items will last up to 8 hours or until the end of a rest, and will never spoil. Eating food created in this way takes an action, providing whomever eats it with healing equal to 2d4 + your cleric level, and can remove either the frightened or poisoned condition from that creature (chosen by the creature when consumed).

sheet.description: Spend 10 minutes creating {{magnificent feast:food:total}} food items that last for 8 hours or until the end of a rest. A creature who takes an action to eat this food heals 2d4 + {{level:cleric}} HP, and removes their choice of frightened or poisoned.

Spend 10 minutes creating {{magnificent feast:food:total}} food items that last for 8 hours or until the end of a rest. A creature who takes an action to eat this food heals 2d4 + {{level:cleric}} HP, aremoves their choice of frightened or poisoned, and removes a single curse or disease.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you can use your Channel Divinity to instill a feeling of vigilant protection in you and your allies. You grant yourself and a number of allies, up to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), a boon from your deity. Allies must be able to see you and be within 30 feet to receive the boon. Once per round, a creature benefitting from this boon can roll a dG, adding the result to a skill check, saving throw, or attack roll. This effect lasts for a number of rounds equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1 round). A creature can only benefit from this effect if it can see at least one of its allies.

sheet.description: Grant yourself and up to {{community watch:modifier}} allies within 30ft who can see you a boon. Once per round, anyone with this boon who can see at least one of its allies can add 1d6 to a skill check, saving throw, or attack roll. This effect lasts {{community watch:modifier}} rounds.

Grant yourself and up to {{community watch:modifier}} allies within 30ft who can see you a boon. This boon makes them immune to fear. Twice per round, anyone with this boon who can see at least one of its allies can add 1d6 to a skill check, saving throw, or attack roll. This effect lasts {{community watch:modifier}} rounds.

description.p: At 8th level, you gain the ability to infuse your weapon with the power to punish wrongdoing. Once on each of your turns, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 psychic damage to the target. Visions of the evil they have wrought upon others flash before their eyes. You choose whether any foe reduced to 0 hit points by this attack remains stable or dies. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

sheet.description: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra {{community domain:divine strike:dice}} psychic damage to the target. You choose whether any foe reduced to 0 hit points by this attack remains stable or dies.

description.p: At 17th level, your Community Watch grants an additional d6 to each affected ally. It also grants immunity to fear for the duration of the effect. Additionally, your Magnificent Feast produces twice as many foodstuffs, each of which can, when consumed, remove a single curse or disease affecting the target (including attunement to a cursed item).
